official-title.#text:
To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to strengthen the Domestic Nuclear Detection Office, and
			 for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Strengthening Domestic Nuclear Security Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Strengthening Domestic Nuclear Security Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following new sections:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title XIX of the Homeland Security Act of 2002

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide support for
			 planning, organization, equipment, training, exercises, and operational
			 assessments to Federal, State, local, territorial, and tribal entities to
			 assist in implementing radiological and nuclear detection capabilities in
			 the event of a radiological or nuclear act of terror or other attack. Such
			 capabilities shall be integrated into the enhanced global nuclear
			 detection architecture referred to in such

, and shall
			 inform and be guided by architecture studies, technology needs, and
			 research activities of the

text.#text: In carrying out the mission of the

header.#text: Domestic implementation of the global nuclear detection architecture

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 consider jurisdictions designated by the Secretary as high-risk urban
			 areas under

, and other cities and regions as appropriate, for
			 the selection of new STC locations.

text.#text: In designating jurisdiction under subsection (a), the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
not later than 30 days after any additions
			 or changes to the jurisdictions participating in the STC program under
			 this section.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee
			 on Appropriations of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall submit to the congressional committees specified
			 in subsection (c) an assessment, including an evaluation of the
			 effectiveness, of the STC program.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Comptroller General of
			 the United States

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text:
$291,000,000 for each of fiscal
			 years 2015 and 2016

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There is authorized to be appropriated

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by striking
			 the item relating to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1(b) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and inserting the following new items:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1907. Joint biennial interagency review of global nuclear detection architecture.
Sec. 1908. Domestic implementation of the global nuclear detection architecture.

text.#text: This Act shall take effect on the date that is 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
